com.pump.image.pixel.quantize

Class BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.pixel.quantize.ColorQuantization
      • com.pump.image.pixel.quantize.BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization

  • public class BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization
extends ColorQuantization
    This is a modified MedianCutColorQuantization.

    Before applying the median cut algorithm: this sorts all colors by frequency. Then, given a fixed threshold, it evaluates which colors occur so frequently that they should be preserved exactly as-is.

    For example: if the color white makes up 15% of the pixels, and you pass a threshold such as .1 (10%), then the color white will be preserved in the reduced palette.

    Without this precaution: important colors may still be averaged with other colors in a cluster.

    (Previous revisions of this class include attempts to offer additional biases (based on human perception of color), but those experiments were abandoned after no discernible improvement was made.)

      Create a BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization with a threshold of .1 (10%).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization

        public BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization()
        Create a BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization with a threshold of .1 (10%).

      • BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization

        public BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization(float pureColorThreshold)
        Create a BiasedMedianCutColorQuantization with a fixed threshold.
        Parameters:
        pureColorThreshold - a fractional value (from 0-1) representing the cut-off point for a color to be considered so important that it is added to the finished set as-is. A recommended value for this is around .1 (10%).

    • Method Detail

      • createReducedSet

        public ColorSet createReducedSet(ColorSet originalSet,
                                 int maximumColorCount,
                                 boolean retainOriginalIntegrity)
        Description copied from class: ColorQuantization
        Create a reduced ColorSet.
        Specified by:
        createReducedSet in class ColorQuantization
        Parameters:
        originalSet - the large color set to reduce.
        maximumColorCount - the number of colors to reduce to.
        retainOriginalIntegrity - if true then the argument originalSet should not be modified. If false: then this method may change the original color set at its discretion. (In some algorithms: this may save a lot of time.)
        Returns:
        a ColorSet that conforms to maximumColorCount. (This method may return the originalSet argument if it was already small enough.)
